meanings.sent1: The old tree trunk had a lichenous appearance, with patches of green and gray.
meanings.sent2: The forest floor was lichenous, creating a beautiful mosaic of colors and textures.
meanings.sent3: The lichenous rocks seemed to be playing hide and seek with the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: Her lichenous coat blended seamlessly with the moss-covered surroundings.
meanings.sent5: The lichenous growth on the ancient ruins added an air of mystery and age to the scene.

meanings.sent1: Scientists conducted a study on the lichenous organisms found in the Arctic tundra.
meanings.sent2: The lichenous symbiosis between algae and fungi fascinated the biology students.
meanings.sent3: The lichenous relationship between the tree and the moss was the envy of the forest.
meanings.sent4: The lichenous partnership between the two organisms was a model of cooperation in nature.
meanings.sent5: The lichenous ecosystem thrived in the harsh conditions of the rocky cliffs.
